clinical_study.brief_title: An Algorithm Driven Sepsis Prediction Biomarker
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of an Algorithm Driven Sepsis Prediction Biomarker

brief_summary.textblock: A sepsis early warning predictive algorithm, InSight, has been developed and validated on a large, diverse patient cohort. In this prospective study, the ability of InSight to predict severe sepsis patients is investigated. Specifically, InSight is compared with a well established severe sepsis detector in the UCSF electronic health record (EHR).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 45 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 45 days

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 45 days

arm_group.description: Healthcare provider receives an alert from InSight for patients trending towards severe sepsis. Healthcare provider also receives information from the severe sepsis detector in the UCSF electronic health record.
Healthcare provider does not receive any alerts from InSight. Healthcare provider receives information from the severe sepsis detector in the UCSF electronic health record.

intervention.description: Upon receiving an InSight alert, healthcare provider follows standard practices in assessing possible (severe) sepsis and intervening accordingly.

Upon receiving information from the severe sepsis detector in the UCSF electronic health record, healthcare provider follows standard practices in assessing possible (severe) sepsis and intervening accordingly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult patients admitted to the participating units will be eligible.
Exclusion Criteria:
- All patients younger than 18 years of age will be excluded.
